website_summaries.verdict: Uses a dual leg strap design and a Y-harness that delivers maximum comfort and security for the weapon.
pros: Versatile unit, because you can add components to give it more features
Blackhawk is a trusted brand name
Unit secures tightly to the leg, allowing you to move freely and run while wearing it
Comfortable enough that you may not even remember you’re wearing it
cons: Some quality control issues, as some products ship without belt attachments

customer_reviews.title: 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could wear it at work. This thing is awesome. Wear it every time I train outside of work and it’s so comfortable I’ve literally forgot I had it on during training and reached for my hip instead. At 6’4” you can imagine most drop legs don’t sit low enough to be comfortable and sit right at my hand, this one does it! Literally the best drop leg I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B. Orton

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in January of this year and have used it daily. First the rubber grips started to wear of quickly. Next threads started to come loose. It doesn't stay at your desired tension. You have to constantly tighten the straps. Last the threading where the Male clasp is just totally failed while on duty. Next thing I knew my taser was just hanging off my leg. Contacted Amazon and they will not help because it's been so long. I am contacting Blackhawk but my fear is that the product I received from Amazon is a knock off and not Genuine. Be aware this product slowly and surely fell apart in under a year.
customer_reviews.author: Doxboi

customer_reviews.title: I have used cheaper leg holsters and had not been happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Blackhawk products are very high quality. I have used cheaper leg holsters and had not been happy with them. This platform, however, is extremely comfortable. It holds well on the leg without sliding around toward the center while running. It is very stable. It was also very easy to attach my serpa holster onto this platform. The belt loops are comfortable, even under the hip belt of my pack, making this a good way to carry a gun while hiking/backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong picture as of 6/10/2018
customer_reviews.text: Wrong picture as of 6/10/2018. Foliage green picture switched with olive drab, and visa versa. But I got the olive drab one, and that's what i wanted. Came with mounting screws for holster. Don't like the rubberized threading in leg straps used to reduce platform movement while running. Don't like the quick disconnect at the tops, just a round plastic piece to hold it together. Will be changing it too regular stronger disconnects.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Slides Down your Leg!!
customer_reviews.text: The product is well made like most Black hawk products. However as a police officer I wear this drop leg holster paired with the Black Hawk quick change adapter, and the left handed Black Hawk Epoch holster for 12 hours a shift. I find myself constantly needing to re-adjust this rig several times every shift due to it always sliding down the leg. Even after tightening the straps this rig will not stay wear you put it. I hate to say it but have recently switched to the Safariland Drop Flex Adapter with Leg Shroud Assembly and this one actually stays high on the leg without needing to be constantly raised back up the leg.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with BlackHawk products
customer_reviews.text: Looks like the real deal and my Serpa II holster fit it perfectly. My only gripe is the fine print says it doesn’t come with mounting hardware. The screws. Didn’t see that until after I got it and then reread the fine print. For some reason the platform does come with screws in the package. . Not sure what they are for because they are the wrong size. They almost fall into the thread hole of the holster. Had to use the screws off my holster hanger to mount it. Silly petty gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Good product that could use some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: Good product, holds to the leg well. I got a geniune product unlike some reviewers. My only issue is that the unit does not get thicker as it runs down the thigh, which means your muzzle usually ends up pointing right at your foot. Blackhawk should make the unit thicker at the bottom to compensate for the slimming of the thigh. I also wish the buckles were quick disconnects like the belt straps are, but it's still a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Jake C

customer_reviews.title: VERY DURABLE
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and fairly comfortable. The quick detach accessories are nice. Altho it can get kinda pricey to get everything set up from changing from drop leg to molle mount and to traditional hip mount. But after you get there swapping from each is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Very satified.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a rig for when I hike in bear country, and I decided on a thigh holster instead of the chest rig. This was right up my alley, as I already owned a blackhawk serpa holster. This is very comfortable. The holster and gun stay put and is very tight against my leg and my backpack does not get in the way of the draw.. Very well made, and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Earle Carlton II

customer_reviews.title: Nah bro. Just nahhhj
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love it. In some way, I still want to. There is this damn squareish hole they decided to carve in or not cast into the design. Dead in the center of the mounting points is this big damn obligatory hole in the middle. I wasn’t upset when I lined my expensive ass holster up to this mounting plate and the holes we’re compatible, I got pissed off when I saw that half of the holes I would need to make in this thing to mount my DARA holster were empty space, so I couldn't even drill new mounting points I just have to find a new use for it. SMH.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph K.

customer_reviews.title: Everything about this is top-notch!  Highly Recommended!  Winner!
customer_reviews.text: Wow- really impressed. Sturdy, well-made in every way. Stays in place while running and jumping through the woods due to ingenious 'rubberized' and elasticized straps that go around your thigh. I probably have smaller thighs than most and this rig easily adjusted down to my size, or could accommodate a huge thigh with all the extra strapping. Flexible platform/paddle/mounting plate conforms comfortably to any leg. The "Y" shaped harness spreads weight for stability and comfort. Once you put this on properly, it can be removed and replaced quickly and easily by just detaching the quick swivel-clips from the belt points, and detaching the two snap-buckles from the thigh. Several mounting points for accessories. Winner!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas U.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and secured carry!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this drop rig to use with my Glock 21 with a Xiphos NTx light. I already had a molded Blackhawk level 3 holster for the pistol/light combo but it wasn’t that comfortable or secure other than if it was on a duty belt. I wasn’t totally sure my holster would work with the rig but my doubts have now been laid to rest. I had no issues attaching my holster to the rig. Right away, my draw was smooth, as was my return to the holster. This rig is comfortable to wear and I’m looking forward to years of use with this new setup!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Comfort Above the Others
customer_reviews.text: This rig is exceptionally comfortable. Adds extra space to my duty belt and can itself hold a flashlight in a molded case, a radio on the thigh straps, etc.. I'm more used to the single thigh retention strap, however, as I transition into civilian security, I'm liking the double strap more and more. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Top notch rig
customer_reviews.text: First off, I am not a big proponent of Blackhawk gear but I bought this for an X2 holster as I couldn’t find a Safariland. Well I was impressed. The double strap is more comfortable and doesn’t pull like my old single strap Safariland X26 drop. Very comfortable. I hate the Blackhawk holster that attaches but firmly recommend this rig.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin5534

customer_reviews.title: Tactical geardo
customer_reviews.text: 4th one I've gone through. The elastic in the straps wore out on 2 in prolonged extreme heat (>125F) and constant use. One destroyed in action. Fantastic add on for tactical gear when you marry it up with the quick disconnect kit. My only beef is that it starts to chaff when you're on a multi-day patrol and you can't take it off; combo sweat generator and collector.
customer_reviews.author: Masterhoda

customer_reviews.title: Do you really need this though?
customer_reviews.text: I love this platform. It's comfortable and it looks badass. But I have two major problems with it. First, I'm a little dude, 64" little. And even completely shortened, the platform still rides a little lower than I need it to. Secondly, this thing is horrifically overpriced! But I'd probably still buy it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rincon

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but the holster that I need it for - Blackhawk doesn't make.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I contacted Blackhawk regarding a holster for my SR40 Ruger and they stated that they don't have one available for that gun. It's very disappointing due to them being in business for over 25 years. Even though I can use my MP Shield gun's holster on this harness, I bought it strictly for my Ruger for work. A bigger gun makes a bigger statement than a smaller one, in my business. "Size does matter". 😉✌️
customer_reviews.author: Cruiselookalike

customer_reviews.title: Belt loop strap connectors defective / bad design
customer_reviews.text: Connectors from platform strap to belt loop straps do no hold or stay together. Come apart with little to no pressure. This is obvious defect and would cause your holster to fail while walking let alone running. This connector Should have been better designed. I have used much better disconnects ...See video I would not recommend this platform set up unless they eliminate the disconnect option or replace with a disconnect that will perform better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kantor

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't slap back and forth like other drop-leg platforms do
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a modular platform where you can swap out holsters, without having to buy extra drop leg platforms, this is what you need. I wish I had this in Iraq; the straps that come off of the belt are hinged, and you can adjust the height of the drop-leg to suit what you need. Mine is set up to ride right on my hip. It doesn't slap back and forth like other drop-leg platforms do, either. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but if you want multiple SERPA holsters to use in a drop leg configuration, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Horrible, straps on leg do not stay tight and the clips that wrap around your waist belt are difficult to fasten , also the screws that came with it are too small and doesnt fit any blackhawk holster that i own ..... totally useless ... jist dont put anything on that side of your plate carrier and stick with a paddle holster ....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper to purchase each part individually than get a whole pack and you get multiple holster I love this holster it’s comfortable you can ride it low or high i have it in civilian world for the range/ I use it on the army marksmanship team and also was just issued it over seas currently for army. I use it with the quick disconnect as well for the black hawk to switch easily between the m9 and sig p320
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is used for my combat belt holster with the EPOCH holster and it works great. Well made and I am a large guy 280 and it fits well on my Condor Battle belt. Even has place to attach 2 9mm clips which I bought off amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Harleyrob66

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the screw kit!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of gear. BUT, it comes with screws to attach your blackhawk serpa style holsters already. Don't purchase the additional screw kit the ad mentions. It isn't necessary. Aside from that, rock solid on all levels.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolner

customer_reviews.title: Will Do the Job
customer_reviews.text: I put a Blackhawk sportsman holster with a Tourniquet Case and Fixed Blade Knife. Magazine Holsters have never been my recommendation. It is annoying to reach across 'your' entire front to get to the extra mags.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F

customer_reviews.title: Like it just fine and mends perfect with all my other Blackhawk products
customer_reviews.text: You either love drop leg holsters or you hate them. Sometimes you have to buy one to figure that out. Personally I like drop leg holsters so long as its not too heavy with my weapon. This did a great job and works fine for my 1911 and SERPA holster. The weight doesn't bother me too much and I have added two magazine clips to the side. in my opinion this is what you should have for your battle belt. Some people hate the weight offset Between legs.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard King

customer_reviews.title: Excelent equipment.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am impressed with the quality and price of BLACKHAWCK platforms.. BLACKHAWK Serpa Concealment Holster mounted to this platform perfectly. This tactical platform is fully adjustable to fit exactly how you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a drop-leg platform for a Glock 23 with a Streamlight TLR8-G; for a while it seemed like I’d never find one. I’m using this with a Blackhawk T-Series L3D holster and it works beautifully. No issues with clearance on the thumb release either.
customer_reviews.author: Jeb

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT IS PICTURED
customer_reviews.text: I DID NOT receive what I ordered...I ordered what was pictured...I did not receive what was pictured...I dont know if it's an older style or newer style... Now...its a Blackhawk...VERY high quality...I make no complaints about that....now I have to wait a few days longer to get use to the drop-leg as I am in need of it her in VA for the 20th of Jan....if you dont know what's going on...research and so support
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah May

customer_reviews.title: Change the top buckles by the belt
customer_reviews.text: The clips for the belt suck. They dont like to click easily and can be easily undone accidentally. Other than that it is nice so if you are like me and can change those buckles and run mostly blackhawk then go for it but the buckles do need changed. I am doing that before I ever think of actually using it but that's a cheap fix so I'm not worried about it. Other than that it is nice. If you have short legs it's not for you. The top adjustments are long and I have long legs and I almost ran out of adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: The dual stabilizing belt hangers are awesome. Anyone who has worn thigh rigs and run, climb, fight or jump know they tend to "walk" around the leg but this one has solved this issue. The Serpa holster bolted right up in minutes with no issues. The adjustments are great and should fit anyone pretty much. The leg buckles are 2 different sizes so as not to get confused when strapping it on in a hurry or in low light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: MIO

customer_reviews.title: -WORKS GOOD ON MY GLOCK 17 GEN 4 FS-
customer_reviews.text: Works and feels great only complaint is that it didn’t even come with any screws to Mount actual holster attachment. Ended up buying a serpa sportster holster that came with the screws.
customer_reviews.author: CHRIS

customer_reviews.title: Hardware not compatible
customer_reviews.text: So I have a level 3 serpa duty holster. I bought this for use on duty at certain locations. The mounting hardware that came with this doesn't even fit my holster... The screws are too small.... How do you screw something that's supposed to be universal amongst your products like this... Thinking about switching to Safariland now...
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good just make sure to add the goodies for it.
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty nice and solid. The straps are of good guilty. They could have threw in the little side rails!😒 Your going to want them so make sure to add them to cart when u buy this, also go ahead and get u a belt, your also going to want one if u don't have a rigging belt. And lastly add there mag holder to fit on the rails your going to want them also if u don't already have mag carriers for rails. Ya, that's about it. Good carry platform. PS: the black hawk QD mount isn't a good match for this platform it sticks off like a sore thumb.
customer_reviews.author: kevz71243Top Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: You will still have to buy Blackhawk holster to mount to this leg holster.
customer_reviews.text: I use a Blackhawk holster on my duty belt with 3 Phillips screws I can take my holster off my duty belt and mount it on this leg drop holster.unforntantly for me my crappy state I live in won't allow me to use this holster for my security job.only law enforcement can use this style of holster.it would have been much easier for me if I could have used this style of holster.
customer_reviews.author: Rick S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Looks so good my coworkers are jealous lol Only thing to be aware it does not fit Safari land 6360 for S&W I had to do some simple drilling and made it fit but it does not fit on its own
customer_reviews.author: Cierra Swinton

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: The y-strap design is an neat feature, but other than that the rig really isn't worth it. Safariland's two-strap leg rig is far better, more comfortable, and flops far less on your leg while moving. G-Code's Mule rig is in my book way better, as it's single strap which allows you to have a higher ride. You can get the RTI strap for the Mule as well. But, in the end, there really is no reason to buy SERPA gear other than to feel cool. Safariland and G-Code are better designed, better quality, and about the same price or cheaper as SERPA gear is.
customer_reviews.author: NSM

customer_reviews.title: It cleared up my belt
customer_reviews.text: I was issued a x26 taser, and this allows me to cheaply remove it from my already crowded duty belt. With a little zip ties I was able to securely mount my mk4 oc, and flashlight in front of the holster. Took a few days to get used to it, but it's working, and comfortable even when running.
customer_reviews.author: bishop1080

customer_reviews.title: Works great and fits grear
customer_reviews.text: Great product and my Blackhawk holster fits on here great. I needed a thigh holster because my backpack strap gets in the way of my hip holster. This was a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: OH

customer_reviews.title: Love this holster mount
customer_reviews.text: great product. was able to mount my 1911 holster and glock holster. love the QD belt connections. secures on the leg pretty well. comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Chau

customer_reviews.title: Blackhawk! delivers again
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy, and this holster fits with room to spare! Just attached a quick disconnect system to it and my everyday carry holster, and life is easy!!
customer_reviews.author: napicatt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome leg holster
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! For Blackhawk holsters..... That is my only reason it is a 4/5 instead of 5/5. I do not like accessories (like a drop platform) that are brand specific. I have my service weapon with a Blackhawk Level 3 and then I have a Bianchi for my personal weapon. I would love to be able to swap the two holster onto this leg platform but I can't. Aside from that complaint, the quality is excellent, and it takes every beating you throw at it. I personally removed the upper leg strap, and keep my holster riding mid thigh, I find that a good combination of comfortable and functional, just a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: It is the best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few (barely less expensive) models, and thought that a leg holster wouldn't work for me. After I set this up, it is actually a different feel and useful. I've been using the holster regularly for 2 months now and am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: K.R.

customer_reviews.title: The Holster that God himself wears...
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the single most comfortable drop leg anything that I have ever worn. It doesn't wiggle. It doesn't get uncomfortable. You can even change out the holsters with ease. This is literally the epitome of holster technology. Everything else is either building up to this or wants to be an exact copy of this. This is the one. This does not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Kenji

customer_reviews.title: Good overall. Some cheap furniture
customer_reviews.text: Good all around platform with the exception of the QD polymer pieces that attach the platform to the belt loop pieces. They failed after detaching once, and do not hold any tension at all. Both straps are standard 1.5 inch, so I bought 1.5 inch cobra buckles to replace. This is an area that can be improved. Everything else is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Duty Use OR Recreational Use.
customer_reviews.text: I use this THP on duty and for recreational shooting. It's been a great platform for the past year and I don't have any complaints. It's been compatible with all of my Blackhawk! equipment (tactical mag pouch, dual switch holster and quick release system) and I have never had a problem with it. In the past some thigh holsters had tended to shift around while in use, however this dual strap design and anti-slip grip inside the straps seem to do a good job with keeping the THP in place on my leg.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: If you using new generation of tasers and want it to be on your leg that this leg holster is for you, me and all my co-workers are happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: RedRusskii

customer_reviews.title: Great thigh rig, used for full sized 1911.
customer_reviews.text: Carries the weight of a 1911 government no problem, completable and secure straps, doesn't get twisted or move around while walking. I already owned several Blackhawk cqc holsters which fit on this perfectly so it was a no brainier when I started thigh rig shopping. Would buy again, but doubt I'll ever need to thanks to the modularity and Blackhawks reputation.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: If you don't mind being "tacticool", its great!
customer_reviews.text: Great tactical hip holster. Pros: Easily adjustable Comfortable - I hiked 10+ miles with this on and had no comfort issues. Fits the other Blackhawk gear Secures my gun and doesn't let it flop around Cons: You look like a doosh who wears "tacticool" gear. I only bought it because I do backcountry backpacking, and I couldnt find a good holster that left my gun accessible while still being comfortable and secure, due to my backpacks straps interfering.
customer_reviews.author: Ben & Michelle

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Color looks a bit much like the ACU, but I don't care that much. Functionality is perfect, and that's where my frustrations were. I had the paddle that fits in a belt, which kept getting crap in the way. Drop leg is free and clear, ease of access, and easy to take off quickly if I have to go in a store that doesn't allow sidearms. I don't like doing that, but when you have a large family, sometimes you don't have a choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Great platform, lacking options
customer_reviews.text: I use this to carry my 1911 on backpacking hikes. I like the way it secures to my leg. The double belt attachment is great. Some slop will still occur, but not near as much as other drop leg holsters I have tried. I rated it 4 stars due to the lack of spare magazine options. There is enough room on both sides to carry a spare magazine, but Blackhawk does not make a magazine that attaches to the platform - at least one I have found (and I searched blackhawk's site and else where's with no luck)
customer_reviews.author: AvidOutdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Wear it right and it works great
customer_reviews.text: I love to wear my rigs high... this allows good holster acquisition and higher up. The strap keeps it tight to my leg. I can run, jump, climb into attics, wrestle, and it has always stayed right where I put it.
customer_reviews.author: B. K. Lord

customer_reviews.title: Every once in awhile, blackhawk makes a good product
customer_reviews.text: And this is one of them. After my first 4 years in the Marines and struggling with the way a one vertical strap holster would wrap around your leg behind you if you ever had to run or jog for any reason, this platform design was like a gift from god. This is my second one, purchased to hold my glock 17 and my first one is now.. 6 years old and still mission ready after carrying beretta and hk. The rubber integrated into the leg straps, the elasticity of those same straps, the two point belt anchor system.. The ability to mount other objects on the platform.. Well played Blackhawk!, well played..
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. One of the best platforms I've owned. I beat the crap out of this thing and cant really find a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Schoob

customer_reviews.title: Great way to carry.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to meet a Blackhawk product that wasn't of the best quality and this holster platform is no exception. Wide, rounded, sturdy platform with quality, adjustable leg straps. The upper and lower straps are different widths, which is nice to make sure to keep each one feeding its own self. Wide belt attach straps with built in swivels to aid movement. Comfortable to wear and even with a .45 and more attached, it's easy to move about. Pistol is right where you naturally reach down to and the SERPA level 2 keeps your gun locked in until you draw.
customer_reviews.author: Walter E Appel

customer_reviews.title: Great addtion
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to the serpa holster system. it places your handgun right on your side where your hand rest so you can have a fast draw. the system works well and is extremely well made. the quick disconnect feature is perfect and work great along with the leg straps that hold on perfectly with some rubber for gripping and have elastic in it. the entire system works great and I even bought another to have on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W

customer_reviews.title: Blackhawk Lv2 holster fits on this( leg) *Tactical holster attachment*
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was faster then I thought I was expecting it in a few more days, I stopped what I was doing to set up my Blackhawk lv 2 holster and un screwed the belt holster and screwed it on my new Blackhawk Tactical holster attachment.. yes it fits !
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: As an overseas contractor in the Middle East this product has won my choice for holsters. It keeps my pistol secure and out of the way of movement / plate carrier. Extremely durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing. I was putting this purchase off for a ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. I was putting this purchase off for a while mainly because I didn't think it was worth the price but I recently started running fabric leg rigs and they are good. But my pistol would fly out when I was at a dead sprint. Now I have tried everything to try and make my pistol break loose but it is completely solid. I definitely endorse this for Airsoft usability
customer_reviews.author: Triton Handel

customer_reviews.title: GET IT!....You will LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say, its the best. Check out my review of it on YouTube under Beyond Seclusion,....see for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Beyond Seclusion

customer_reviews.title: Handsome and effective.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for getting my X-26 taser with blackhawk level 2 holster off my belt and freeing up space. I also mounted a flashlight holder onto it but it had to be canted due to the holder's asinine triangular screw placement; as if one would use the center mounts just to mount a flashlight! I have also gotten compliments on the way it looks. I just wish my department allowed us to mount a firearm on it but alas, can't go looking too tactical now can we?
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Bought it a second time.
customer_reviews.text: Been using one for years. Got into a bug use of force and it ended up breaking so I bought the same one again. Got exactly what I ordered, fits great, very pleased. Price has dropped over the years since I first purchased it, so that was a nice surprise as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: A great holster
customer_reviews.text: This item is heavy duty. It's easy to assemble with your SERPA holster. Takes about 5 minutes. The fastsnaps are heavy duty, the platform is slightly contoured to sit on your leg well, and everything is adjustable to just the way you like it. The platform is supremely comfortable to wear- the central piece of plastic is very sturdy, but flexes around your thigh in a way that makes it comfortable from just about any angle. The thigh straps are also slightly flexible and extremely pleasant to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Whiskey Killer

customer_reviews.title: So much better than a duty belt
customer_reviews.text: This thing is saving my back. My last job made us wear duty belts all the time. My new job lets me use an outer carrier with this drop leg. I have noticed an incredible difference in the way my back feels. It does move up and down with my pant leg but it’s no big deal. My Blackhawk EPOCH holster screwed right on with no issues. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy thomas

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: it is exactly what i wanted now i just need to take it out and test it. it will adjust to just about any way you need it to fit you.
customer_reviews.author: robert sledge

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable sturdy and secure. I have a glock 22 with a viridian X5L laser/light. blackhawk does not make any holster for that gun light combo. i have a holster for the gun with that light made by viridian and is basically a blackhawk holster. so i took a chance and tried it. It works great. I unscrewed my holster from the paddle and used the screws that came with the platform to attach the holster to the platform. works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Product fastening system failed.
customer_reviews.text: One of the quick release clips will not stay locked in place during movement, could not stay fastened. Product failed me during performance of my duty.
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. wright

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Holds my M&P or Walther PPQ, a spare mag, and my ESEE-4 knife. Comfortable and secure.
customer_reviews.author: Smoke

customer_reviews.title: Good drop rig
customer_reviews.text: Blackhawk does a great job of making a lot of tactical gear, and this is no exception. This is the best leg rig I have ever used. It is stable, has rubberized straps to help hold the rig in place when moving (though no rig I have found yet will stop all movement), and you can remove the holster without having to take the attachments off the belt. This allows you the versatility of being able to switch between the drop let and the normal hip holsters.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very confortable and well needed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best drop leg holster to me! I added a serpa quick disconnect to the platform and it works amazing. You can add different holsters if you have the female end on the holsters and male end on the platform.
customer_reviews.author: King Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this product however I have a small issue with the clips for where the belt loops attach to the main unit. The clips are round and you have to fiddle a little when clipping them together. It takes a little getting used to but once you do it's not a big deal. Like I said, overall its a solid product and if you need a solution like this I would grab one.
customer_reviews.author: Stoic_Ronin

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, fits well, didn't give it five stars because I think the round belt clips should be the standard two-finger quick release type. Over all great!
customer_reviews.author: Vyper Snake

customer_reviews.title: Nonconforming
customer_reviews.text: I do not arrive in the original house? Well I doubt its originality
customer_reviews.author: elvis

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable rig.
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing this for about 4 months straight & I love it! I use it for a taser. The rig does not prevent you from running and doesn't slow you down either.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and performance
customer_reviews.text: I combined this with a Serpa 2 holster and it works great, totally adjustable, fits tight, and does not flop around when drawing. You can remove the holster and leave the clips on your belt, to easily put it back on quickly without unbuckling your belt. Very durable and works great for a backup when hunting and wearing a long coat in the cold. Best holster rig I have ever had, doesnt move around when drawing/reholstering, very natural draw and holster position. A++
customer_reviews.author: Phil McCrackin

customer_reviews.title: It does its job
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday for work. Super comfortable and hold to my leg well. Just buy the quick detach too
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Should of bought this year's ago. Helps a lot when you spend most of your time seated. Especially when the holster is on your hip and it's uncomfortable to sit on and/or jams into your hip or side. Used my level 3 Blackhawk holster and mounted easily. Came with screws and washers. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Credible

customer_reviews.title: Too much angle
customer_reviews.text: Solid built and comfortable. Problem is it cants the holster out from your thigh waaaaay too far. The outward angle makes it ugly and impracticle for duty use. If it kept the holster flat against your thigh id give 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: The best drop leg out there
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different drop leg platforms, and this one beats them all. Most other drop legs have a huge problem with moving around on your leg while running or even walking, but this one is as solid as a rock. It only takes Serpa holsters, but that's certainly not a problem for me. The polymer is durable as anything, and the double belt loop design helps stabilize the whole thing. Can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Angrypencils

customer_reviews.title: Tac holster
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product. Adjustable at several points to get it to fit me perfectly. My other tac holster attaches to my belt at a single point and pulls down hard at my side. This attaches at 2 points and spreads out the weight. My serpa holster attached right to it. The only problem was that the hardware bag was missing a screw. It had the 3 washers but only 2 screws. You will need the longer screws for this! Other than that it great!
customer_reviews.author: MrLarry0001

customer_reviews.title: Works great black hawk is the best
customer_reviews.text: I just needed the thigh rig for my CZ P-10 and it works great if anyone is curious for a CZ P10F or C an black hawk seeps for a MP 9mm or .40cal fits it perfect thanks black hawk
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas DeFelice

customer_reviews.title: Product is good, serve the purpose
customer_reviews.text: This product is very much what I wanted to work with my tactical vest, it has all the features I need, quick disconnect thigh straps & from the vest. Also works well with quick disconnect holster to thigh system. The only thing I am not keen on is the adapter for quick disconnect is a bit too thick where the holster sticks out away from my thigh, in tight situations it'll not work well. Overall its a tough, reliable system.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Great product, cheaper than buying locally and received it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, cheaper than buying locally and received it within a week. Great platform and described perfectly so fits like a glove with my other holsters. So glad to have made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Prez

customer_reviews.title: Great for Taser holster
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Bought it for my Taser X26P holster. Took the space off my duty belt. Very comfortable. Took a little adjustment but got it working well.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDON

customer_reviews.title: Great platform
customer_reviews.text: Great drop leg holster, i use it for paintball, i just need to get my Kydex holster on it, as of right now i made a cloth one work. This platform is amazing though.
customer_reviews.author: Martin stehl

customer_reviews.title: Proven by police
customer_reviews.text: Great product for police officers like me. It is a little time consuming to fit to your leg but that doesn’t sacrifice from the security of the rig. It hardly moves at all when running.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua N

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy solid set up
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and solid product. Easy to set up and really comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Groff

customer_reviews.title: Use your brain when ordering.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Didn't expect the platform to be flexible. Secure. Legit product. Ordered coyote brown, saw tan in the picture. I expected tan. My fault, really, and I need this now, so a return isn't possible. I wish tan was an option, presently.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mattison

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Its a Blackhawk so its gotta be good
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Its a Blackhawk so its gotta be good. Rubber sewn in to hold it in place on your leg. If you are looking to buy a thigh rig this is the one you should buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Modular with all Blackhawk Holsters.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, and sung to the leg. The Y-harness distributes the weight across your main the belt. You can mount the Blackhawk Omnivore holster to this platform just need longer screws and washers.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great Quality, it is working as expected. Perfect for when you are wearing an external vest carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: Second one i have purchased.... There is absolutely nothing negative about this product. It excepts Serpa Holsters as if they were ment to be there. No movement or play between the connections, fits snug on thigh and stays in position. I recomend this product for both professional and leasure use. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Auggie

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in black hawk. Good leg drop but and holster you buy to fit it is a thumbs down
customer_reviews.author: Collin Mccray

customer_reviews.title: If you are on the sense I suggest to buy ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are on the sense I suggest to buy it high-quality worth the investment there may be cheaper options but Blackhawk products are the way to go
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but the screws it came with did ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it, but the screws it came with did not workout. I had to use the screws off my belt clip
customer_reviews.author: Troy Goff

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I can put my XD .45 and Glock 23 Serpa holsters on it. I recently used it with my XD .45 Tactical 5" as my side arm while hunting. This is by far the most comfortable drop leg holster platform I have ever used. I love the dual belt straps and the quick release clips allows you to take it off or put it back on in a matter of seconds. I have ZERO complaints about this!
customer_reviews.author: Troy Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: Sits low on my leg, real low, like it for range shootin though, I have to tighten down the straps basically all the way leaves a lot of slack just hanging around. There's probably a way around it but if I remember correctly there's like no paperwork for it. Albeit very intuitive to figure out I can only give it a 4 star
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Shackelford

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff and Service!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and I highly recommend a Level 2 or Level 3 Retention Holster to go along with it so the side arm stays when you sit and tumble or whatever. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: jojoRod

customer_reviews.title: Great drop leg rig.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is comfortable, adjustable, & solid fit against your body. Because I use the qdc adapters it easily adjusts to differant angles, which really comes in handy while riding or driving.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ed Mont

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a Safariland holster. Had to do some slight modifications, but it worked and I like it. Could still buy a Blackhawk holster and put it on if I wanted, but this works just fine. Holds the rig solid in place unlike a single attachment point holster I had before. This is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: David Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a must if your looking for a good quality drop leg platform for work. I use this at time 10 hours a day for 40 hours a week and I absolutely love it keeps my G17 right where it needs to be especially when running. I haven't had any issues with it and would highly recommend it as a duty holster platform
customer_reviews.author: Jason & Kelli
